name: aws-dynamodb
label: AWS DynamoDB
description: AWS DynamoDB is a fully managed NoSQL database service that provides fast and predictable performance with seamless scalability. This connector facilitates the automate operations related to manage database table, data and backup.

fields.title: Configuration Type
fields.name: config_type
fields.description: Type of configuration using which you will provide credentials to access AWS DynamoDB and perform automated actions. You can select between Access Credentials or AWS Instance IAM Role. If you select Access Credentials, then enter details in the following field(s): AWS Region: AWS region of your account to access the AWS CloudWatch Logs. AWS Access Key ID: ID of the AWS Access Key to access AWS services. AWS Secret Access Key: Key of the AWS Secret Access to access AWS services. If you select AWS Instance IAM Role then specify AWS Instance IAM Role Name to access AWS Services.

AWS Instance IAM Role.title: AWS Instance IAM Role Name
AWS Instance IAM Role.name: aws_iam_role
AWS Instance IAM Role.tooltip: IAM Role Name of your AWS Instance where FortiSOAR installed, to access AWS services.
AWS Instance IAM Role.description: IAM Role Name of your AWS Instance where FortiSOAR installed, to access AWS services.

Access Credentials.title: AWS Region
Access Credentials.name: aws_region
Access Credentials.tooltip: AWS region of your account to access the AWS DynamoDB
Access Credentials.description: AWS region of your account to access the AWS DynamoDB

Access Credentials.title: AWS Access Key ID
Access Credentials.name: aws_access_key
Access Credentials.tooltip: ID of the AWS Access Key to access AWS services
Access Credentials.description: ID of the AWS Access Key to access AWS services

Access Credentials.title: AWS Secret Access Key
Access Credentials.name: aws_secret_access_key
Access Credentials.tooltip: Key of the AWS Secret Access to access AWS services
Access Credentials.description: Key of the AWS Secret Access to access AWS services

fields.title: Verify SSL
fields.description: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified or not. By default, this option is set as True.
fields.name: verify_ssl

operations.title: Create Table
operations.description: Create a new table in AWS DynamoDB with the specified table name.

parameters.title: Assume a Role
parameters.name: assume_role
parameters.tooltip: Enable to assume a role
parameters.description: Select this option to assume a role. This parameter is required, if you have specified 'IAM Role' as the 'Configuration Type'. If you have specified 'Access Credentials' as the 'Configuration Type', then this parameter is optional. If you choose 'True', then you must specify the following parameters: AWS Region: AWS region of your account to access the AWS Access Analyzer Role ARN: ARN of the role that you want assume to execute this action on AWS. Session Name: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.

true.title: AWS Region
true.name: aws_region
true.tooltip: Your account's AWS region
true.description: AWS region of your account to access the AWS Access Analyzer

true.title: Role ARN
true.name: role_arn
true.tooltip: ARN of the role that you want assume to execute this action on AWS.
true.description: ARN of the role that you want assume to execute this action on AWS.

true.title: Session Name
true.name: session_name
true.tooltip: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.
true.description: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.

parameters.title: Table Name
parameters.description: Specify the table name that you want create in AWS DynamoDB.A table name should be between 3 and 255 characters, containing only letters, numbers, underscores (_), hyphens (-), and periods (.).
parameters.tooltip: Specify the table name. A table name should be between 3 and 255 characters, containing only letters, numbers, underscores (_), hyphens (-), and periods (.)
parameters.name: TableName

parameters.title: Partition Key Name
parameters.description: Specify the partition key is part of the table's primary key. It is a hash value that is used to retrieve items from your table and allocate data across hosts for scalability and availability.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the partition key. 1 to 255 characters and case sensitive.
parameters.name: partitionKeyName

parameters.title: Partition Key Data Type
parameters.description: Specify the data type for the partition key
parameters.tooltip: Specify the data type for the partition key
parameters.name: partitionKeyDataType

parameters.title: Sort Key (Optional)
parameters.description: Specify the sort key is second part of the table's primary key. The sort key allows you to sort or search among all items sharing the same partition key.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the sort key is second part of the table's primary key. The sort key allows you to sort or search among all items sharing the same partition key.
parameters.name: sortKey

true.title: Sort Key Name
true.description: A name of the sort key.
true.tooltip: Specify a name of the sort key. 1 to 255 characters and case sensitive.
true.name: sortKeyName

true.title: Sort Key Data Type
true.description: The data type for the sort key
true.tooltip: Specify the data type for the sort key
true.name: sortKeyDataType

parameters.title: Billing Mode
parameters.description: Specify this controls how you are charged for read and write throughput and how you manage capacity.
parameters.tooltip: Select 'Provisioned' mode for predictable workloads or Select 'On Demand' for unpredictable workloads.
parameters.name: billingMode

Provisioned.title: Read Capacity
Provisioned.description: Specify the maximum number of strongly consistent reads consumed per second in the table.
Provisioned.tooltip: Specify the maximum number of strongly consistent reads consumed per second in the table.
Provisioned.name: readCapacityUnits

Provisioned.title: Write Capacity
Provisioned.description: Specify the maximum number of writes consumed per second in the table.
Provisioned.tooltip: Specify the maximum number of writes consumed per second in the table.
Provisioned.name: writeCapacityUnits

operations.description: Delete an existing table from AWS DynamoDB

parameters.tooltip: Specify table name to be deleted

Modify Provisioned Throughput.title: Billing Mode
Modify Provisioned Throughput.description: Specify this controls how you are charged for read and write throughput and how you manage capacity.
Modify Provisioned Throughput.tooltip: Select 'Provisioned' mode for predictable workloads or Select 'On Demand' for unpredictable workloads.

Provisioned.tooltip: The maximum number of writes consumed per second
Provisioned.name: writeCapacityUnits

Enable or Disable DynamoDB Streams.title: Stream Status
Enable or Disable DynamoDB Streams.description: Enables or disable DynamoDB Streams on the table.
Enable or Disable DynamoDB Streams.tooltip: Check to enable DynamoDB Streams on the table.
Enable or Disable DynamoDB Streams.name: streamEnabled

Enable.title: Stream View Type
Enable.description: Capture item-level changes in your table, and push the changes to a DynamoDB stream.
Enable.tooltip: Select which information to be pushed on DynamoDB stream for any changed items in the table
Enable.name: streamViewType

Create a New Global Secondary Index.description: The name of the global secondary index to be created.
Create a New Global Secondary Index.tooltip: A index name should be between 3 and 255 characters, containing only letters, numbers, underscores (_), hyphens (-), and periods (.)

Create a New Global Secondary Index.description: The data type for the partition key

Create a New Global Secondary Index.title: Sort Key (Optional)
Create a New Global Secondary Index.description: The sort key of the global index.
Create a New Global Secondary Index.tooltip: The sort key allows you to sort or search among all items sharing the same partition key.
Create a New Global Secondary Index.name: sortKey

operations.title: Create Global Table
operations.description:
Creates a global table for the existing table. This operation only applies to Version 2017.11.29 of global tables. Make sure that following conditions are satisfied by existing table before creating Global Table for the same.
 1. A Table must be empty. 
 2. A Log stream with type 'New and Old Images' must be enabled for a table.

parameters.title: Assume a Role
parameters.name: assume_role
parameters.tooltip: Enable to assume a role
parameters.description: Select this option to assume a role. This parameter is required, if you have specified 'IAM Role' as the 'Configuration Type'. If you have specified 'Access Credentials' as the 'Configuration Type', then this parameter is optional. If you choose 'True', then you must specify the following parameters: AWS Region: AWS region of your account to access the AWS Access Analyzer Role ARN: ARN of the role that you want assume to execute this action on AWS. Session Name: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.

operations.title: Get Global Table List
operations.description: Retrieves list of all the global tables that have a replica in the specified Region.

parameters.title: Assume a Role
parameters.name: assume_role
parameters.tooltip: Enable to assume a role
parameters.description: Select this option to assume a role. This parameter is required, if you have specified 'IAM Role' as the 'Configuration Type'. If you have specified 'Access Credentials' as the 'Configuration Type', then this parameter is optional. If you choose 'True', then you must specify the following parameters: AWS Region: AWS region of your account to access the AWS Access Analyzer Role ARN: ARN of the role that you want assume to execute this action on AWS. Session Name: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.
